org.gearvrf

Class GVRBaseShaderManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRBaseShaderManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GVRShaderManagers
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRMaterialShaderManager, GVRPostEffectShaderManager

    public abstract class GVRBaseShaderManager
extends GVRHybridObject
implements GVRShaderManagers
    Encapsulates the implementation shared between GVRMaterialShaderManager and GVRPostEffectShaderManager.

    • Field Detail

      • mShaderTemplates

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends GVRShaderTemplate>,GVRShaderTemplate> mShaderTemplates
        Maps the shader template class to the instance of the template. Only one shader template of each class is necessary since shaders are global.

    • Method Detail

      • addShader

        public GVRShaderId addShader(java.lang.String pathPrefix,
                             java.lang.String vertexShader_asset,
                             java.lang.String fragmentShader_asset)
        Adds a shader from sources in the assets directory. Assumes the shaders use GLSL ES version 100.
        Specified by:
        addShader in interface GVRShaderManagers
        Parameters:
        pathPrefix - Optional (may be null) prefix for shader filenames. If present, will be prepended to vertexShader and fragmentShader, thus allowing you to build a tree of shaders in your assets directory, where each node contains vertex and fragment shaders with the same filename. If null, vertexShader and fragmentShader are the path names of files in the assets directory.
        vertexShader_asset - Filename of a vertex shader, relative to the assets directory
        fragmentShader_asset - Filename of a fragment shader, relative to the assets directory
        Returns:
        ID of new shader added

      • addShader

        public GVRShaderId addShader(java.lang.String pathPrefix,
                             java.lang.String vertexShader_asset,
                             java.lang.String fragmentShader_asset,
                             GVRBaseShaderManager.GLSLESVersion glslesVersion)
        Adds a shader from sources in the assets directory.
        Parameters:
        pathPrefix - Optional (may be null) prefix for shader filenames. If present, will be prepended to vertexShader and fragmentShader, thus allowing you to build a tree of shaders in your assets directory, where each node contains vertex and fragment shaders with the same filename. If null, vertexShader and fragmentShader are the path names of files in the assets directory.
        vertexShader_asset - Filename of a vertex shader, relative to the assets directory
        fragmentShader_asset - Filename of a fragment shader, relative to the assets directory
        glslesVersion - GLSL ES version used by the shaders
        Returns:
        ID of new shader added

      • newShader

        public GVRShaderId newShader(int vertexShader_resRaw,
                             int fragmentShader_resRaw)
        Adds a shader from sources in res/raw. Assumes the shaders use GLSL ES version 100.
        Specified by:
        newShader in interface GVRShaderManagers
        Parameters:
        vertexShader_resRaw - R.raw id, for a file containing a vertex shader
        fragmentShader_resRaw - R.raw id, for a file containing a fragment shader
        Returns:
        An opaque type that you can pass to GVRShaderManagers.getShaderMapping(GVRShaderId) or to the GVRMaterial and GVRPostEffect constructors and setShader methods.

      • newShader

                             GVRBaseShaderManager.GLSLESVersion glslesVersion)
        Adds a shader from sources in res/raw.
        Parameters:

        fragmentShader_resRaw - R.raw id, for a file containing a fragment shader
        glslesVersion - GLSL ES version used by the shaders

      • newShader

        public GVRShaderId newShader(java.io.InputStream vertexShader_stream,
                             java.io.InputStream fragmentShader_stream)
        Adds a shader from sources in separate input streams. Assumes the shaders use GLSL ES version 100.
        Specified by:
        newShader in interface GVRShaderManagers
        Parameters:
        vertexShader_stream - GLSL source code for a vertex shader. Stream will be closed when method returns.
        fragmentShader_stream - GLSL source code for a fragment shader. Stream will be closed when method returns.
        Returns:
        An opaque type that you can pass to GVRShaderManagers.getShaderMapping(GVRShaderId) or to the GVRMaterial and GVRPostEffect constructors and setShader methods.

      • newShader

        public GVRShaderId newShader(java.io.InputStream vertexShader_stream,
                             java.io.InputStream fragmentShader_stream,
                             GVRBaseShaderManager.GLSLESVersion glslesVersion)
        Adds a shader from sources in separate input streams.
        Parameters:
        vertexShader_stream - GLSL source code for a vertex shader. Stream will be closed when method returns.
        fragmentShader_stream - GLSL source code for a fragment shader. Stream will be closed when method returns.
        glslesVersion - GLSL ES version used by the shaders

      • retrieveShaderTemplate

        public GVRShaderTemplate retrieveShaderTemplate(java.lang.Class<? extends GVRShaderTemplate> templateClass)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Retrieves the shader template of the specified class. A shader template is capable of generating multiple variants from a single shader source. The exact vertex and fragment shaders are generated by GearVRF based on the lights being used and the material attributes. Only one template of a given class is necessary because shaders are global. The shader manager controls instantiation of the shader instances but you may subclass GVRShaderTemplate to create your own shader templates.
        Parameters:
        templateClass - class (subclass of GVRShaderTemplate)
        Returns:
        instance of GVRShaderTemplate or null on error GVRShaderTemplate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
